Movie Title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Synopsis: Based on the best-selling novel by Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower is a modern classic that captures...
Cast: Logan Lerman, Emma Watson, Ezra Miller, Mae Whitman
Consensus: The Perks of Being a Wallflower is a heartfelt and sincere adaptation that's bolstered by strong lead performances.

Synopsis: For 10 idyllic years, young Mija (An Seo Hyun) has been caretaker and constant companion to Okja--a massive animal and...
Cast: Tilda Swinton, Paul Dano, Seo-hyeon Ahn, Byun Hee-bong
Consensus: Okja sees Bong Joon-ho continuing to create defiantly eclectic entertainment -- and still hitting more than enough of his narrative targets in the midst of a tricky tonal juggling act.

Synopsis: Set backstage at three iconic product launches and ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac, Steve Jobs takes...
Cast: Michael Fassbender, Kate Winslet, Seth Rogen, Katherine Waterston
Consensus: Like the tech giant co-founded by its subject, Steve Jobs gathers brilliant people to deliver a product whose elegance belies the intricate complexities at its core.

Synopsis: Four-time Oscar (R)-winning filmmakers Joel and Ethan Coen (No Country for Old Men, True Grit, Fargo) write and direct Hail,...
Cast: Josh Brolin, George Clooney, Tilda Swinton, Ralph Fiennes
Consensus: Packed with period detail and perfectly cast, Hail, Caesar! finds the Coen brothers delivering an agreeably lightweight love letter to post-war Hollywood.

Synopsis: A group of people transform into zombies in a small Canadian town. Labeled the "hungry," they feast upon their loved...
Cast: Marc-Andre Grondin, Monia Chokri, Micheline Lanctôt, Brigitte Poupart
Consensus: Uncommonly restrained for a movie about a flesh-eating menace, Ravenous offers a satisfyingly nuanced entry in the crowded zombie apocalypse subgenre.

Movie Title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
Synopsis: Seeking vengeance when his partner (Simpson) is shot full of holes by drug dealers, Lt. Frank Drebin searches for the...
Cast: Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, Ricardo Montalban, George Kennedy
Consensus: The Naked Gun is chock full of gags that are goofy, unapologetically crass, and ultimately hilarious.

Synopsis: Angelina Jolie directed this biopic about a human rights activist and her attempts to survive during the oppressive Khmer Rouge...
Cast: Sreymoch Sareum, Phoeung Kompheak, Sveng Socheata, Tharoth Sam
Consensus: First They Killed My Father tackles its subject matter with grace, skill, and empathy, offering a ground-level look at historic atrocities that resonates beyond its story's borders.

Synopsis: Only three centuries ago, setting out to climb a mountain would have been considered close to lunacy. Mountains were places...
Cast: Willem Dafoe
Consensus: Mountain offers a visually thrilling -- and surprisingly affecting -- look at man's relationship with some of Earth's most imposing natural wonders.

Synopsis: Kept locked inside the house by her father, 7-year-old Chloe lives in fear and fascination of the outside world, where...
Cast: Emile Hirsch, Bruce Dern, Grace Park, Amanda Crew
Consensus: Stocked with solid performances, Freaks is a clever sci-fi/horror hybrid that suggests a bright future for co-writers/co-directors Zach Lipovsky and Adam Stein.

Synopsis: TAMBIEN LA LLUVIA sets up an intriguing dialogue about Spanish imperialism through incidents taking place some 500 years apart, while...
Cast: Luis Tosar, Juan Carlos Aduviri, Karra Elejalde, Gael García Bernal
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: After a pair of films about hipster slackers, the work of writer-director Kevin Smith matured and gained critical respect with...
Cast: Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Jason Lee, Dwight Ewell
Consensus: Chasing Amy explores gender roles, sexual mores, and the limits of friendship with a mixture of sensitivity, raw honesty, and director/screenwriter Kevin Smith's signature raunchy humor.

Synopsis: What if virtual reality wasn't just for fun, but was being used to imprison you? That's the dilemma that faces...
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano
Consensus: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.

Synopsis: A biting, penetrating and often humorous take on contemporary life in suburban America, Lester Burnham becomes intrigued by a young...
Cast: Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch, Wes Bentley
Consensus: Flawlessly cast and brimming with dark, acid wit, American Beauty is a smart, provocative high point of late '90s mainstream Hollywood film.

Synopsis: A complex portrait of a contemporary American marriage, "Blue Valentine" tells the story of David and Cindy, a couple who...
Cast: Ryan Gosling, Michelle Williams, Faith Wladyka, John Doman
Consensus: This emotionally gripping examination of a marriage on the rocks isn't always easy to watch, but Michelle Williams and Ryan Gosling give performances of unusual depth and power.

Synopsis: Imagine the end of the world. Now imagine something worse. Award-winning filmmaker Trey Edward Shults follows his incredible debut feature...
Cast: Joel Edgerton, Riley Keough, Christopher Abbott, Carmen Ejogo
Consensus: It Comes at Night makes lethally effective use of its bare-bones trappings while proving once again that what's left unseen can be just as horrifying as anything on the screen.

Synopsis: Visionary filmmaker Christopher Nolan (Memento, The Dark Knight) writes and directs this psychological sci-fi action film about a thief who...
Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio, Ken Watanabe, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Marion Cotillard
Consensus: Smart, innovative, and thrilling, Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.

Movie Title: Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom
Synopsis: Chronicling events that unfolded over 93 days in 2013 and 2014, this documentary witnesses the formation of a new civil...
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Burning Sands takes you on a raw, voyeuristic journey of fraternity pledging through the eyes of one favored pledgee, who...
Cast: Trevor Jackson, Alfre Woodard, Trevante Rhodes, DeRon Horton
Consensus: Burning Sands covers familiar territory, but Trevor Jackson's layered performance and director/co-writer Gerard McMurray's empathetic approach help set it apart.

Director: lan Bank, Daniel DiMauro, Morgan Pehm
Synopsis: After the 2016 election, people all over the world woke up to find that Donald J. Trump, New York real...
Cast: Roger Stone, Donald Trump, Paul Manafort, Jeffrey Toobin
Consensus: As informative as it is entertaining, Get Me Roger Stone offers a close-up look at the right-wing gadfly who helped shape the 2016 presidential election.

Synopsis: As their parents head out for a date in the city, the three young Thompson children immediately take to their...
Cast: Sarah Bolger, Joshua Rush, Carly Adams, Thomas Bair
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: La Ciotat, the South of France. Antoine attends a summer writing workshop in which a few young people have been...
Cast: Marina Foïs, Matthieu Lucci, Warda Rammach, Issam Talbi
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Tremors is actually two movies in one. On its own terms, it's an enjoyable modern sci-fi horror-thriller, with good pacing...
Cast: Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Rhonda Le Beck
Consensus: An affectionate throwback to 1950s creature features, Tremors reinvigorates its genre tropes with a finely balanced combination of horror and humor.

Synopsis: Data, arguably the world's most valuable asset, is being weaponized to wage cultural and political wars. The dark world of...
Consensus: The Great Hack offers an alarming glimpse of the way data is being weaponized for political gain -- and what it might mean for future elections.

Synopsis: Leo has a secret. A mysterious illness has transformed him into a phantom boy, able to leave the confines of...
Cast: Audrey Tautou, Fred Armisen, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Édouard Baer
Consensus: Phantom Boy's stunning animation and old-fashioned charm more than make up for a relative lack of narrative depth.

Synopsis: In fine Hollywood tradition, John Wayne had to play a "one-eyed fat man" before the Motion Picture Academy considered him...
Cast: John Wayne, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall
Consensus: True Grit rides along on the strength of a lived-in late-period John Wayne performance, adding its own entertaining spin to the oft-adapted source material.

Synopsis: An aspiring NYC playwright (Jessica Williams) gets over a painful breakup by bonding with a man who was also recently...
Cast: Jessica Williams, LaKeith Stanfield, Noël Wells, Taliyah Whitaker
Consensus: The Incredible Jessica James makes its standard storyline feel new, almost purely on the strength of a captivating, potentially star-making performance from Jessica Williams.

Movie Title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Synopsis: The third installment in the Spielberg/Lucas Indiana Jones saga, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade evokes many of the thrills...
Cast: Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, Denholm Elliott
Consensus: Lighter and more comedic than its predecessor, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade returns the series to the brisk serial adventure of Raiders, while adding a dynamite double act between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery.

Synopsis: Stranded in rural Australia in the aftermath of a violent pandemic, an infected father desperately seeks a new home for...
Cast: Martin Freeman, Natasha Wanganeen, David Gulpilil, Anthony Hayes
Consensus: Cargo takes a refreshingly character-driven approach to the zombie genre that's further distinguished by its Australian setting and Martin Freeman's terrific lead performance.

Synopsis: This coming-of-age drama follows 13-year-old Morris as he moves to Heidelberg, Germany with his father and adjusts to his vastly...
Cast: Markees Christmas, Carla Juri, Lina Keller, Jakub Gierszal
Consensus: Morris from America adds some novel narrative twists to its father-son story -- and gains added resonance thanks to a powerful performance from Craig Robinson.

Synopsis: In this taut psychological thriller by Karyn Kusama (Girlfight, Jennifer's Body), the tension is palpable when Will (Logan Marshall-Green, Prometheus)...
Cast: Michiel Huisman, Logan Marshall-Green, John Carroll Lynch, Tammy Blanchard
Consensus: The Invitation makes brilliant use of its tension-rich premise to deliver a uniquely effective -- and surprisingly clever -- slow-building thriller.

Synopsis: Rebecca Hall stars in director Antonio Campos' third feature film, CHRISTINE, the story of a woman who finds herself caught...
Cast: Rebecca Hall, Michael C. Hall, Tracy Letts, Maria Dizzia
Consensus: Rising on the strength of Rebecca Hall's gripping performance, Christine offers an empathetic look at its subject's public career and painful private life.

Synopsis: Directed by Clint Eastwood, the mysterious drama Mystic River is based on the novel by Dennis Lehane and adapted by...
Cast: Sean Penn, Tim Robbins, Kevin Bacon, Laurence Fishburne
Consensus: Anchored by the exceptional acting of its strong cast, Mystic River is a somber drama that unfolds in layers and conveys the tragedy of its story with visceral power.

Synopsis: Colin Farrell stars as David, a man who has just been dumped by his wife. To make matters worse, David...
Cast: Colin Farrell, Rachel Weisz, Léa Seydoux, Ben Whishaw
Consensus: As strange as it is thrillingly ambitious, The Lobster is definitely an acquired taste -- but for viewers with the fortitude to crack through Yorgos Lanthimos' offbeat sensibilities, it should prove a savory cinematic treat.

Synopsis: In "Ralph Breaks the Internet," video-game bad guy Ralph (voice of John C. Reilly) and best friend Vanellope von Schweetz...
Cast: John C. Reilly, Sarah Silverman, Gal Gadot, Jack McBrayer
Consensus: Ralph Breaks the Internet levels up on its predecessor with a funny, heartwarming sequel that expands its colorful universe while focusing on core characters and relationships.

Synopsis: From the Marvel Cinematic Universe comes a new chapter featuring heroes with the astonishing ability to shrink: "Ant-Man and The...
Cast: Paul Rudd, Evangeline Lilly, Michael Peña, Walton Goggins
Consensus: A lighter, brighter superhero movie powered by the effortless charisma of Paul Rudd and Evangeline Lilly, Ant-Man and The Wasp offers a much-needed MCU palate cleanser.

Synopsis: Looking for work, Aaron (Patrick Brice) comes across a cryptic online ad: "$1,000 for the day. Filming service. Discretion is...
Cast: Mark Duplass, Patrick Brice
Consensus: A smart, odball take on found-footage horror, Creep is clever and well-acted enough to keep viewers on the edges of their seats.

Movie Title: The Desert Bride (La Novia del Desierto)
Synopsis: 54-year-old Teresa has worked for decades as a live-in maid with a family in Buenos Aires. When the family sells...
Cast: Claudio Rissi, Paulina García
Consensus: Unassuming yet surprisingly impactful, The Desert Bride offers an absorbing, well-acted reflection on life's surprises and the unlikely connections we make along the way.

Movie Title: Joan Didion: The Center Will Not Hold
Synopsis: Across more than 50 years of essays, novels, screenplays, and criticism, Joan Didion has been our premier chronicler of the...
Cast: Amy Robinson, David Hare, Hilton Als, Phyllis Rifield
Consensus: Joan Didion: The Center Will Not Hold pays tribute to an American literary legend with a richly personal perspective that should thrill devotees while enlightening newcomers.

Synopsis: Legendary action director Yuen Woo-Ping draws on a stellar cast (Michelle Yeoh, Dave Bautista, Tony Jaa, and Max Zhang) to...
Cast: Zhang Jin, Dave Bautista, Yan Liu, Michelle Yeoh
Consensus: Master Z: Ip Man Legacy marks a departure from previous entries in the franchise -- but its thrilling action set pieces remain every bit as satisfying.

Synopsis: Using never-before-heard recordings, rare archival footage and her best-known songs, this is the story of legendary singer and activist Nina...
Cast: Nina Simone
Consensus: What Happened, Miss Simone? is a compelling -- albeit necessarily incomplete -- overview of its complex subject's singular artistic legacy and fascinating life.

Synopsis: Fifteen years ago, Mel (Madeleine Sami) and Jen (Jackie van Beek) discovered they were being two-timed by the same man....
Cast: Jackie van Beek, Madeleine Sami, Celia Pacquola, James Rolleston
Consensus: The Breaker Upperers brings the laughs early and often, thanks to the dry wit -- and effervescent chemistry -- of writer-director-star duo Jackie van Beek and Madeleine Sami.

Synopsis: "You've got to ask yourself a question: 'do I feel lucky?' Well, do ya, punk?" Dirty Harry provoked a critical...
Cast: Clint Eastwood, Andrew Robinson, Harry Guardino, John Mitchum
Consensus: As tough and taciturn as its no-nonsense hero, Dirty Harry delivers a deceptively layered message without sacrificing an ounce of its solid action impact.

Synopsis: A harrowing but meticulously observed look at teenage lives in the era prior to the Columbine High School massacre, SUPER...
Cast: Owen Campbell, Charlie Tahan, Elizabeth Cappuccino, Max Talisman
Consensus: Rich in atmosphere and period detail, Super Dark Times is an effective teen thriller whose true power lies in its approach to deeper themes.

Movie Title: I don't feel at home in this world anymore.
Synopsis: Fed up with the human indecency she sees around her and set off by her home being burglarized, Ruth (Melanie...
Cast: Melanie Lynskey, Elijah Wood, David Yow, Jane Levy
Consensus: I don't feel at home in this world anymore. transcends its unwieldy title to offer timely, intoxicatingly dark observations on gender dynamics and social norms in modern America.

Movie Title: On Body and Soul (A Teströl és Lélekröl)
Synopsis: Two introverted people find out by pure chance that they share the same dream every night. They are puzzled, incredulous,...
Cast: Alexandra Borbély, Morcsányi Géza, Réka Tenki, Zoltán Schneider
Consensus: Tender performances and a strong sense of style combine to create an eccentric, dreamy portrait of love and loneliness in On Body and Soul.

Synopsis: From Academy Award (R)-nominee Hiromasa Yonebayashi - animator on Studio Ghibli masterpieces Spirited Away, Howl's Moving Castle, and Ponyo, and...
Cast: Hana Sugisaki, Ryûnosuke Kamiki, Yuki Amami, Fumiyo Kohinata
Consensus: Mary and the Witch's Flower honors its creator's Studio Ghibli roots with a gentle, beautifully animated story whose simplicity is rounded out by its entrancing visuals.

Synopsis: Childhood sweethearts have a falling out and don't speak for 15 years. They reconnect as adults when Sasha, now a...
Cast: Ali Wong, Randall Park, Keanu Reeves, Michelle Buteau
Consensus: Carried by the infectious charms of Ali Wong and Randall Park, Always Be My Maybe takes familiar rom-com beats and cleverly layers in smart social commentary to find its own sweet groove.

Synopsis: BLOOD FATHER stars Mel Gibson as Link, an ex-convict who fights to protect his estranged daughter from the drug cartel...
Cast: Mel Gibson, Erin Moriarty (II), Diego Luna, Michael Parks
Consensus: Blood Father meets every expectation a film fan could have for a latter-day Mel Gibson action thriller with its title -- and even, in some respects, handily exceeds them.

Synopsis: A man raised by gorillas must decide where he really belongs when he discovers he is a human....
Cast: Tony Goldwyn, Glenn Close, Minnie Driver, Rosie O'Donnell
Consensus: Disney's Tarzan takes the well-known story to a new level with spirited animation, a brisk pace, and some thrilling action set-pieces..

Synopsis: For super-dog "Bolt", every day is filled with adventure, danger and intrigue - at least until the cameras stop rolling....
Cast: John Travolta, Malcolm McDowell, Mark Walton, Miley Cyrus
Consensus: Bolt is a pleasant animated comedy that overcomes the story's familiarity with strong visuals and likable characters.

Synopsis: BLUE IS THE WARMEST COLOR centers on a 15-year-old girl named Adèle (Exarchopoulos) who is climbing to adulthood and dreams...
Cast: Léa Seydoux, Adèle Exarchopoulos, Salim Kechiouche, Jérémie Laheurte
Consensus: Raw, honest, powerfully acted, and deliciously intense, Blue Is the Warmest Color offers some of modern cinema's most elegantly composed, emotionally absorbing drama.

Synopsis: Frustrated with the direction of the church, Cardinal Bergoglio (Jonathan Pryce) requests permission to retire in 2012 from Pope Benedict...
Cast: Jonathan Pryce, Anthony Hopkins, Juan Minujín, Thomas D Williams
Consensus: Led by outstanding performances from its well-matched leads, The Two Popes draws absorbing drama from a pivotal moment in modern organized religion.

Synopsis: During the summer of 1979, a Santa Barbara single mom and boardinghouse landlord (Annette Bening) decides the best way she...
Cast: Annette Bening, Elle Fanning, Greta Gerwig, Lucas Jade Zumann
Consensus: 20th Century Women offers Annette Bening a too-rare opportunity to shine in a leading role -- and marks another assured step forward for writer-director Mike Mills.

Synopsis: Set during the winter of 1981 -- statistically one of the most crime-ridden of New York City's history -- A...
Cast: Oscar Isaac, Jessica Chastain, David Oyelowo, Albert Brooks
Consensus: Gritty, gripping, and weighted with thought-provoking heft, A Most Violent Year represents another strong entry in writer-director J.C. Chandor's impressive filmography.

Synopsis: "Inglourious Basterds" begins in German-occupied France, where Shosanna Dreyfus witnesses the execution of her family at the hand of Nazi...
Cast: Brad Pitt, Mélanie Laurent, Christoph Waltz, Eli Roth
Consensus: A classic Tarantino genre-blending thrill ride, Inglourious Basterds is violent, unrestrained, and thoroughly entertaining.

Synopsis: The long-awaited sequel to Baahubali: The Beginning, one of the top-grossing Indian epic historical fantasy films of all-time, the conclusion...
Cast: Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: A shocking exposé of how pharmaceutical companies use patent law to keep profits unconscionably high even at the expense of...
Cast: William Hurt, Bill Clinton, Zackie Achmat, Linda-Gail Bekker, MD
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: The Night Comes For Us follows Ito (played by Joe Taslim), a former triad enforcer, and his mission to protect...
Cast: Joe Taslim, Iko Uwais, Julie Estelle, Sunny Pang
Consensus: A bloody thrill ride designed to test the limits of more squeamish viewers, The Night Comes for Us wields a stylishly violent, action-packed punch.

Synopsis: Veronica has taken care of her little brother and sister since the death of their father. One day during a...
Cast: Sandra Escacena, Bruna González, Claudia Placer
Consensus: A scarily effective horror outing, Veronica proves it doesn't take fancy or exotic ingredients to craft skin-crawling genre thrills.

Synopsis: Former high school sweethearts Jim (Mark Duplass) and Amanda (Sarah Paulson) have been out of touch for more than 20...
Cast: Mark Duplass, Sarah Paulson, Clu Gulager
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Based on the best-selling novel written by Kent Haruf and adapted for the screen by Scott Neustadter and Michael H....
Cast: Jane Fonda, Robert Redford, Bruce Dern, Matthias Schoenaerts
Consensus: Our Souls at Night honors the quiet strength of its source material by offering a simple yet sturdy canvas for two talented veteran leads to bring its story to life.

Synopsis: 1922 is based on Stephen King's 131-page story telling of a man's confession of his wife's murder. The tale is...
Cast: Thomas Jane, Molly Parker, Dylan Schmid, Kaitlyn Bernard
Consensus: Thanks to director Zak Hilditch's patient storytelling and strong work from lead Thomas Jane, 1922 ranks among the more satisfying Stephen King adaptations.

Synopsis: An unlikely friendship between two misfit neighbors becomes an unexpectedly emotional journey when the younger man is diagnosed with terminal...
Cast: Ray Romano, Mark Duplass
Consensus: It takes its time coming together, but the quietly effective Paddleton pulls off a tricky tonal balancing act, thanks largely to the strengths of its well-chosen leads.

Synopsis: La Bamba is the story of 1950s rock 'n' roll rage Ritchie Valens (born Ricardo Valenzuela), played herein with gusto...
Cast: Lou Diamond Phillips, Esai Morales, Danielle von Zerneck, Rosanna DeSoto
Consensus: Elevated by a perceptive performance by a perfectly cast Lou Diamond Phillips, La Bamba distills its subject's creative energy -- and reflects his music's enduring appeal.

Synopsis: A teenager, David, journeys to Montana to hunt big game with his estranged father, Cal. Father and son struggle to...
Cast: Matt Bomer, Josh Wiggins, Bill Pullman, Lily Gladstone
Consensus: Beautifully filmed and powerfully acted, Walking Out effectively balances tense father-son drama against an affecting wilderness survival story.

Synopsis: Gilbert has to care for his brother Arnie and his obese mother, which gets in the way when love walks...
Cast: Johnny Depp, Leonardo DiCaprio, Juliette Lewis, Mary Steenburgen
Consensus: It's sentimental and somewhat predictable, but those are small complaints, given the tender atmosphere and moving performances at the heart of What's Eating Gilbert Grape.

Synopsis: Michael Dorsey is a talented actor, but his demanding nature and stubborn temperament have antagonized every producer in New York....
Cast: Dustin Hoffman, Jessica Lange, Teri Garr, Dabney Coleman
Consensus: Tootsie doesn't squander its high-concept comedy premise with fine dialogue and sympathetic treatment of the characters.

Synopsis: In 1946, a banker named Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is convicted of a double murder, even though he stubbornly proclaims...
Cast: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
Consensus: The Shawshank Redemption is an uplifting, deeply satisfying prison drama with sensitive direction and fine performances.

Synopsis: I AM MOTHER is a sci-fi thriller about a teenage girl (Clara Rugaard), who is the first of a new...
Cast: Hilary Swank, Clara Rugaard, Rose Byrne, Luke Hawker
Consensus: Suspenseful, well-acted, and intelligent, I Am Mother is an ambitious sci-fi story that largely achieves its impressive aims.

Synopsis: Lazzaro is a naive and optimistic twenty-year-old farmer; Tancredi is instead a young man with a fervid imagination. Between the...
Cast: Adriano Tardiolo, Alba Rohrwacher, Tommaso Ragno, Luca Chikovani
Consensus: Happy as Lazzaro uses a friendship's ups and downs as a satisfyingly expansive canvas for a picture rich with thematic and cinematic depth.

Synopsis: A blend of science fiction and noir detective fiction, Blade Runner (1982) was a box office and critical bust upon...
Cast: Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young, Daryl Hannah
Consensus: Misunderstood when it first hit theaters, the influence of Ridley Scott's mysterious, neo-noir Blade Runner has deepened with time. A visually remarkable, achingly human sci-fi masterpiece.

Synopsis: For aspiring comedian Donna Stern, everyday life as a female twenty-something provides ample material for her incredibly relatable brand of...
Cast: Jenny Slate, Gaby Hoffmann, David Cross, Jake Lacy
Consensus: Tackling a sensitive subject with maturity, honesty, and wit, Obvious Child serves as a deeply promising debut for writer-director Gillian Robespierre.

Synopsis: Maria Enders (Juliette Binoche) is an actress at the peak of her international career who is asked to perform in...
Cast: Juliette Binoche, Kristen Stewart, Chloë Grace Moretz , Lars Eidinger
Consensus: Bolstered by a trio of powerful performances from its talented leads, Clouds of Sils Maria is an absorbing, richly detailed drama with impressive depth and intelligence.

Synopsis: An astronaut miner extracting the precious moon gas that promises to reverse the Earth's energy crisis nears the end of...
Cast: Sam Rockwell, Dominique McElligott, Matt Berry, Robin Chalk
Consensus: Boosted by Sam Rockwell's intense performance, Moon is a compelling work of science-fiction, and a promising debut from director Duncan Jones.

Director: Roger Deakins, Joel Coen, Ethan Coen
Synopsis: "A Serious Man" is the story of an ordinary man's search for clarity in a universe where Jefferson Airplane is...
Cast: Michael Stuhlbarg, Richard Kind, Fred Melamed, Sari Lennick
Consensus: Blending dark humor with profoundly personal themes, the Coen brothers deliver what might be their most mature -- if not their best -- film to date.

Synopsis: Based on a short story by the late Philip K. Dick, this science fiction-thriller reflects the writer's familiar preoccupation with...
Cast: Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow
Consensus: Thought-provoking and visceral, Steven Spielberg successfully combines high concept ideas and high octane action in this fast and febrile sci-fi thriller.

Synopsis: Director Neill Blomkamp teams with producer Peter Jackson for this tale of extraterrestrial refugees stuck in contemporary South Africa. It's...
Cast: Sharlto Copley, David James, Vanessa Haywood, Mandla Gaduka
Consensus: Technically brilliant and emotionally wrenching, District 9 has action, imagination, and all the elements of a thoroughly entertaining science-fiction classic.

Synopsis: In this exquisitely made and terrifying new horror film, the age-old concepts of witchcraft, black magic and possession are innovatively...
Cast: Anya Taylor-Joy, Ralph Ineson, Kate Dickie, Harvey Scrimshaw
Consensus: As thought-provoking as it is visually compelling, The Witch delivers a deeply unsettling exercise in slow-building horror that suggests great things for debuting writer-director Robert Eggers.

Synopsis: The suburra, a rough neighborhood of Rome, is the scene of an ambitious real estate project. But, with the state,...
Cast: Greta Scarano, Pierfrancesco Favino, Jean-Hugues Anglade, Elio Germano
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Kyle and Mike are best friends who share a close bond -- until Mike sleeps with Kyle's fiancée. The Climb...
Cast: Kyle Marvin, Michael Angelo Covino, Gayle Rankin, Talia Balsam
Consensus: The Climb uses the complicated bond between two friends to dissect male friendships in engaging -- and frequently funny -- fashion.

Synopsis: Walt, a down-on-his luck carpenter, is tasked with entertaining his eight-year-old son Anthony while Anthony's mom and her new husband...
Cast: Clive Owen, Maria Bello, Patton Oswalt, Spencer Drever
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Spike Lee's breakthrough independent feature, shot in fifteen days on a budget of $175,000, ushered in (along with Jim Jarmusch's...
Cast: Spike Lee, Tracy Camilla Johns, Tracy Camila Johns, Tommy Redmond Hicks
Consensus: With She's Gotta Have It, Spike Lee delivered his bracing first shot across Hollywood's bow -- and set the template for the groundbreaking act to follow.

Movie Title: Nobody Speak: Trials of the Free Press
Synopsis: When the online tabloid Gawker posted a surreptitiously filmed sex tape of professional wrestler Hulk Hogan, it ignited a high...
Cast: Hulk Hogan, Bubba the Love Sponge, Nick Denton, Peter Thiel
Consensus: Nobody Speaks: The Trials of the Free Press persuasively -- and entertainingly -- outlines the troubling tensions threatening journalism in the internet era.

Synopsis: In this heart-pounding thriller from acclaimed writer and director Mike Flanagan (Oculus, Before I Wake), silence takes on a terrifying...
Cast: Michael Trucco, Kate Siegel, Samantha Sloyan, John Gallagher Jr.
Consensus: Hush navigates the bloody waters of home invasion thrillers and incisive slashers for a contemporary horror puree.

Movie Title: Like Water for Chocolate (Como Agua para Chocolate)
Synopsis: Based on the best-selling novel by Laura Esquival, this internationally popular romantic fable from Mexico centers on a young woman...
Cast: Lumi Cavazos, Marco Leonardi, Mario Ivan Martinez, Regina Torné
Consensus: Like Water for Chocolate plays to the senses with a richly rewarding romance that indulges in magical realism to intoxicating effect.

Movie Title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory
Synopsis: Promoted as a family musical by Paramount Pictures, Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory is more of a black comedy,...
Cast: Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum, Michael Bollner
Consensus: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory is strange yet comforting, full of narrative detours that don't always work but express the film's uniqueness.

Synopsis: Gerald Burlingame (Bruce Greenwood) and his wife Jessie (Carla Gugino) attempt to rekindle the flames of their marriage with a...
Cast: Carla Gugino, Bruce Greenwood, Henry Thomas, Chiara Aurelia
Consensus: Carla Gugino carries Gerald's Game's small-scale suspense with a career-defining performance.

Synopsis: Mark Renton (Ewan McGregor), a young man with few prospects and fewer ambitions, lives in economically depressed Edinburgh. Like most...
Cast: Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Kevin Mckidd
Consensus: A brutal, often times funny, other times terrifying portrayal of drug addiction in Edinburgh. Not for the faint of heart, but well worth viewing as a realistic and entertaining reminder of the horrors of drug use.

Synopsis: Writer-director Sarah Colangelo's sophomore feature film is based on the 2014 Israeli film of the same name. Maggie Gyllenhaal plays...
Cast: Maggie Gyllenhaal, Parker Sevak, Rosa Salazar, Michael Chernus
Consensus: Elevated by a bravura performance from Maggie Gyllenhaal, The Kindergarten Teacher is one American remake that retains its impact the second time around.

Synopsis: Gerry is a talented poker player, but his gambling habit is getting the best of him. One day, he meets...
Cast: Ben Mendelsohn, Ryan Reynolds, Sienna Miller, Robin Weigert
Consensus: Well-acted and steeped in Southern atmosphere, Mississippi Grind is a road movie and addiction drama that transcends each of its well-worn genres.

Movie Title: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie
Synopsis: The Netflix Television Event EL CAMINO: A BREAKING BAD MOVIE reunites fans with Jesse Pinkman (Emmy-winner Aaron Paul). In the...
Cast: Aaron Paul, Jesse Plemons, Charles Baker (II), Jonathan Banks
Consensus: Entertaining if not essential, El Camino adds a satisfying belated coda to the Breaking Bad story -- led by a career-best performance from Aaron Paul.

Synopsis: Inspired by a true story, THE SAPPHIRES follows four vivacious, young and talented Australian Aboriginal girls from a remote mission...
Cast: Chris O'Dowd, Deborah Mailman, Jessica Mauboy, Shari Sebbens
Consensus: While it's plenty predictable and sentimental, The Sapphires also has an irresistible feel-good vibe, winning music and charming performances to spare.

Synopsis: With sly humor and an intensity of feeling, THE SPECTACULAR NOW (directed by James Ponsoldt) creates a vivid, three-dimensional portrait...
Cast: Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley, Brie Larson, Mary Elizabeth Winstead
Consensus: The Spectacular Now is an adroit, sensitive film that avoids typical coming-of-age story trappings.

Synopsis: Ivan Locke (Hardy) has worked diligently to craft the life he has envisioned, dedicating himself to the job that he...
Cast: Tom Hardy, Bill Milner, Andrew Scott, Ruth Wilson
Consensus: A one-man show set in a single confined location, Locke demands a powerful performance -- and gets it from a never-more-compelling Tom Hardy.

Synopsis: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs is a six-part Western anthology film, a series of tales about the American frontier told...
Cast: Tim Blake Nelson, Bill Heck, James Franco, Liam Neeson
Consensus: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs avoids anthology pitfalls with a consistent collection tied together by the Coen brothers' signature blend of dark drama and black humor.

Synopsis: Writer-director Paul Thomas Anderson steps outside his contemporary world of dysfunctional Angelenos to explore a very different dysfunctional man --...
Cast: Daniel Day-Lewis, Paul Dano, Kevin J. O'Connor, Ciarán Hinds
Consensus: Widely touted as a masterpiece, this sparse and sprawling epic about the underhanded "heroes" of capitalism boasts incredible performances by leads Daniel Day-Lewis and Paul Dano, and is director Paul Thomas Anderson's best work to date.

Synopsis: GREEN ROOM is a brilliantly crafted and wickedly fun horror-thriller starring Patrick Stewart as a diabolical club owner who squares...
Cast: Anton Yelchin, Imogen Poots, Patrick Stewart, Alia Shawkat
Consensus: Green Room delivers unapologetic genre thrills with uncommon intelligence and powerfully acted élan.

Synopsis: After a botched bank robbery lands his younger brother in prison, Constantine Nikas (Robert Pattinson) embarks on a twisted odyssey...
Cast: Robert Pattinson, Benny Safdie, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Buddy Duress
Consensus: A visual treat filled out by consistently stellar work from Robert Pattinson, Good Time is a singularly distinctive crime drama offering far more than the usual genre thrills.

Synopsis: Mark Wahlberg stars in Paramount Pictures' inspirational docudrama exploring the remarkable rise of Massachusetts-born, junior welterweight title winner "Irish" Micky...
Cast: Christian Bale, Mark Wahlberg, Amy Adams, Melissa Leo
Consensus: Led by a trio of captivating performances from Mark Wahlberg, Christian Bale, and Amy Adams, The Fighter is a solidly entertaining, albeit predictable, entry in the boxing drama genre.

Synopsis: With A GHOST STORY, acclaimed director David Lowery (AIN'T THEM BODIES SAINTS, PETE'S DRAGON) returns with a singular exploration of...
Cast: Casey Affleck, Rooney Mara, Will Oldham, Kenneisha Thompson
Consensus: A Ghost Story deftly manages its ambitious themes through an inventive, artful, and ultimately poignant exploration of love and loss.
